feed.title: Bloch-Elkouby Lab for Suicide Prevention and Psychotherapy Research
feed.subtitle: Dr Sarah Bloch-Elkouby is an Assistant Professor, Ferkauf Graduate School of Psychology, Yeshiva University

entry.title: ADAA 2024 Using cutting edge AI research to enhance clinical training and suicide prevention symposium

link.title: ADAA 2024 Using cutting edge AI research to enhance clinical training and suicide prevention symposium

entry.content: Dr. Bloch-Elkouby will chair a symposium “Using cutting edge AI research to enhance clinical training and suicide prevention” at the upcoming ADAA 2024 conference in Boston on April 11 - 14, 2024.
entry.summary: Dr. Bloch-Elkouby will chair a symposium “Using cutting edge AI research to enhance clinical training and suicide prevention” at the upcoming ADAA 2024 conference in Boston on April 11 - 14, 2024.

entry.title: Bergin and Garfield’s Emerging Scholars Award

link.title: Bergin and Garfield’s Emerging Scholars Award

entry.content: Dr. Bloch-Elkouby was awarded the Bergin and Garfield Emerging Scholar Award by Society for Psychotherapy Research.
entry.summary: Dr. Bloch-Elkouby was awarded the Bergin and Garfield Emerging Scholar Award by Society for Psychotherapy Research.

entry.title: AFSP Focus Grant Award
entry.content: American Foundation for Suicide Prevention awarded $1.5M FOCUS grant for the project “Effectivness of Diagnostic vs. Symptom-Only Suicide Crisis Syndrome Assessment (SCS-A) for post-discharge suicide prevention (Co-investigator: Dr. Bloch-Elkoby)
entry.summary: American Foundation for Suicide Prevention awarded $1.5M FOCUS grant for the project “Effectivness of Diagnostic vs. Symptom-Only Suicide Crisis Syndrome Assessment (SCS-A) for post-discharge suicide prevention (Co-investigator: Dr. Bloch-Elkoby)
